title: Constructing sinusoidal functions
description: Learn how to find the formula of a sinusoidal function from its graph or a few selected features. Model real-world situations with sinusoidal functions.

title: Normal distributions
description: What percent of people are taller than 2 meters? What percent of people taking the SAT will score more than three standard deviations about the mean? This tutorial will cover how to use Normal distributions to solve problems like these.

title: Basic addition and subtraction
description: Adding and subtracting is the basis of all mathematics.  This tutorial introduces you to one-digit addition and subtraction.

title: Intro to negative numbers
description: What are negative numbers? When do we use them? Where do we find them on the number line? Let's learn what happens in the world below zero!

title: Comparing 2-digit numbers
description: Learn how to compare two-digit numbers by thinking about place value (tens and ones).

title: Basic multiplication
description: Introduction to multiplication.

title: Number opposites
description: Opposite numbers are the same distance from 0 on opposite sides of the number line. A number opposite is sometimes called an additive inverse.

title: Worked example: Whole numbers on the number line
Comparing 3-digit numbers
description: Learn how to compare three-digit numbers by thinking about place value (hundreds, tens, and ones).

title: Addition and subtraction word problems within 10
description: Learn how to solve addition and subtraction word problems with small numbers. Numbers used are 10 or less.

title: Ways to represent multiplication
description: Sal explains different ways to represent 7 times 5.

title: Absolute value
description: You'll find absolute value absolutely straightforward--it is just the "distance from zero". If you have a positive number, it is its own absolute value. If you have a negative number, just make it positive to get the absolute value. As you see as you develop mathematically, this idea will eventually extended to more contexts and dimensions, so super important that you understand this core concept now.  Common Core Standards: 6.NS.C.7, 6.NS.C.7c, 6.NS.C.7d

title: Addition and subtraction within 20
description: Add and subtract numbers 20 or less.  Find the missing number in addition and subtraction equations.

title: Identify and order absolute values
description: Use a number line to find absolute value and then order absolute values from least to greatest.

title: Subtracting different ways
description: Sal subtracts numbers using models and number lines.

title: Intro to place value
description: Learn about whole number place values, create numbers with given place values, and use place value blocks to identify a number.

title: Word problems within 20
description: Learn how to solve addition and subtraction word problems. Numbers used are 20 or less.

title: Absolute value word problems
description: Learn to solve word problems that ask us to apply our new absolute value knowledge.

title: Multiplication tables for 10, 11, 12
description: Learn to multiply 10, 11, and 12 using 'times tables.'

title: Division intro
description: Welcome to the concept of division.

title: Properties of multiplication
description: Learn about the commutative, associative, and distributive properties of multiplication.  Solve multiplication problems by changing the order of factors (commutativity), the grouping of factors (associativity), and by decomposing the factors (distributive property).

title: Place value: comparing same digit in different places
description: Learn the relationship between a "4" in the hundreds place and a "4" in the thousands place.

title: Word problems with "more" and "fewer"
description: Learn how to solve word problems that use the words "more" and "fewer". Numbers used are 20 or less.

title: How 10 relates to place value
description: Learn to multiply and divide whole numbers by 10.  Learn how multiplying and dividing by 10 affects place value.

title: Intro to subtracting negative numbers
description: Learn why subtracting a negative number is the same as adding its opposite!

title: Intro to addition with 2-digit numbers
description: Learn how to add two-digit numbers. By the end of this tutorial, you'll be able to solve problems like 48+6 and 48+21. More advanced problems like 48+28 will be covered in a future tutorial.

title: Example: Adding 2-digit numbers (no carrying)
description: Adding Whole Numbers and Applications 1

title: Multiplying by tens
description:
As we'll see in this tutorial, multiplying a multiple of 10--like 10, 20, 30, 40, etc.--by a single digit number is not too much more complicated.

Common Core Standard: 3.NBT.A.3

title: Adding & subtracting negative numbers
description: Add and subtract negative numbers using a number line. It's the 7th grade mathematics shuffle: "Slide to the left for a negative value, and slide to the right for a positive value." Be careful, though. Which way do you move if you are subtracting a negative number? The answer awaits!

title: Ways to write whole numbers (expanded form and written form)
description: Learn to write whole numbers in expanded form, written form, and standard form.

title: Intro to subtraction with 2-digit numbers
description: Learn how to subtract two-digit numbers. By the end of this tutorial, you'll be able to solve problems like 48-9 and 48-31. More advanced problems like 48-29 will be covered in a future tutorial.

title: Multiplication by 10s, 100s, and 1000s
description: Learn to multiply whole numbers by multiples of ten. Example: 7 x 500 = 3500

title: Adding & subtracting with negatives on the number line
description: Learn how to use number lines to solve negative number addition and subtraction problems.

title: Strategies for adding and subtracting within 100
description: Learn strategies for adding and subtracting 2-digit numbers.

title: Regrouping whole numbers
description: Regroup whole numbers based on their place values.

title: Multiplication: place value and area models
description: Most people learn to multiply, but only a select-few actually understand what the multiplication represents. This tutorial, with the help of grids and area models, will allow you to be part of this elite group.

title: Multiplying & dividing negative numbers
description: You already know how to multiply and divide whole numbers, decimals, and fractions. See what happens when we throw negative numbers into the mix. It's really not so different!

title: Lattice multiplication
description: Sal introduces lattice multiplication.

title: Rounding whole numbers
description: If you're looking to create an army of robot dogs, will it really make a difference if you have 10,300 dogs, 9,997 dogs or 10,005 dogs? Probably not. All you really care about is how many dogs you have to, say, the nearest thousand (10,000 dogs). In this tutorial, you'll learn about conventions for rounding whole numbers. Very useful when you might not need to (or cannot) be completely precise.  Common Core Standard: 4.NBT.A.3

title: Word problems within 100
description: Learn how to solve addition and subtraction word problems. Numbers used 100 or less.

title: Multiplying 2-digit by 2-digit: 36x23
description: Learn to multiply two-digit numbers.  In this video, we will multiply 36 times 23.

title: Multiplying 2-digit by 2-digit: 23x44
description: Learn to multiply two-digit numbers.  In this video, we will multiply 23 times 44.

title: Intro to Roman numerals
description: Let's get a quick introduction to what Roman numerals are why we learn about them.

title: Adding 1s, 10s, and 100s
description: Learn how to solve addition problems by adding ones, tens, and hundreds.

title: Reading and writing Roman numerals
description: Let's learn how to read and write Roman numerals.

title: Roman numerals worked example
description: Let's look at an example of how to convert a number from the usual Hindu-Arabic numerals to Roman numerals.

title: Relating multiplication and division
description: Let's see how multiplication and division are related.

title: Read Roman numerals
description: Let's learn how to read Roman numerals like LXVII by converting them into decimal numbers.

title: Convert to Roman numerals
description: Practice converting between roman numerals and the Hindu-Arabic numerals.

title: More about fractions
description: Sal shows fractions as parts of a whole and parts of a group.

title: Subtracting 1s, 10s, and 100s
description: Learn how to solve addition problems by adding ones, tens, and hundreds.

title: Strategies for adding 2- and 3-digit numbers
description: Learn strategies for solving addition problems within 1000.

title: Intro to division
description: Introduction to division.

title: Ways to represent division
description: Sal explains different ways to represent 18 divided by 2.

title: Fractions on the number line
description: Learn to identify fractions on a number line.

title: Addition with regrouping within 1000
description: Learn how to add numbers like 259 + 363. These addition problems are a harder than the ones we've done before because they require regrouping (also called carrying).

title: Comparing fractions
description: In this tutorial, we'll practice understanding what quantities fractions actually represent and comparing those to each other.

title: Division problems that work out nicely
description: Learn to solve division problems like 3500 ÷ 50 that work out nicely.

title: Rewriting decimals as fractions
description: Learn how to rewrite decimals as fractions.

title: Addition and subtraction greater than 1000
description: Learn strategies for adding and subtracting numbers greater than 1000.

title: Division: place value and area
description: Dividing big numbers can be difficult to wrap your mind around. In this tutorial, we'll learn some visual ways to think through large division problems.

title: Alternate mental subtraction method
description: Sal explains how he subtracts numbers like 9456 and 7589 in his head.

title: Rewriting tricky fractions to decimals
description: Learn to convert the fraction, 17/93 to a decimal.

title: Equivalent fractions 1
description: Learn how to create equivalent fractions using visuals.

title: Adding decimals
description: You get the general idea of decimals and what the digits in different places represent (place value). Now you're ready to do something with the decimals. Adding and subtracting is a good place to start. This will allow you to add your family's expenses to figure out if your little brother is laundering money (perhaps literally). Have fun!  Common Core Standard: 5.NBT.B.7

title: Multi-digit division (no remainders)
description: Learn to divide multi-digit numbers by 1-digit numbers.  Answers will not have remainders.

title: Equivalent fractions on the number line
description: Learn how to identify fractions on a number line.

title: Remainders
description: Some division problems don't work out perfectly. For example, we know that 6 divided by 3 is 2, and 9 divided by 3 is 3. But, what is 7 divided by 3? Or 8 divided by 3? In division problems like these, we're left with remainders.

title: Equivalent fractions 2
description: Learn how to find equivalent fractions by multiplying the numerator and denominator by the same number.

title: Adding decimals: standard algorithm
description: Honestly, once you remember one very important rule, the rest of adding and subtracting decimals is a snap. That rule is to be sure and align your decimals first. In this tutorial, you'll get a chance to practice this with us and become fluent adding decimals. We'll tackle subtracting decimals in the next tutorial.

title: Overview and history of algebra
description:
Did you realize that the word "algebra" comes from Arabic (just like "algorithm" and "al jazeera" and "Aladdin")?  And what is so great about algebra anyway?  

This tutorial doesn't explore algebra so much as it introduces the history and ideas that underpin it.

title: Equivalent fractions
description: Learn how to write equivalent fractions.

title: Multi-digit division (remainders)
description: Learn to divide any whole number by a multiple-digit whole number.

title: Subtracting decimals
description: Anything you can do with whole numbers, you can do with decimals.  Subtraction is no exception.  In this tutorial, you'll get some good practice subtracting decimals up the hundredths place.

title: Intro to long division (remainders)
description: Introduction to long division with remainders

title: Introduction to variables
description: Wait, why are we using letters in math? How can an 'x' represent a number? What number is it? This tutorial is great if you're just beginning to delve into the world of variables and expressions.

title: Dividing by 2-digits: 6250÷25
description: Learn to divide a  2-digit number into a larger number.

title: Common denominators
description: Using our knowledge of equivalent fractions, let's rewrite fractions to have the same denominator.

title: Partial quotient method of division: introduction
description: Sal demonstrates an alternate to traditional long division that uses estimation

title: Substitution and evaluating expressions
description: Learn how to substitute (or "plug in") values for variables and evaluate algebraic expressions.

title: Decomposing fractions
description: See that a fraction can be broken up (or decomposed) into a bunch of other fractions.

title: Partial quotient method of division: example using very large numbers
description: Another example of doing long division using the partial quotient method

title: Multiplication and division word problems
description: In this tutorial, we'll start to challenge you with more sophisticated multiplication and division word problems. If you understand mult-digit multiplication and long division, you have all the tools you need to tackle these. May the force be with you!

title: Adding and subtracting fractions with like denominators
description: Learn how to add and subtract fractions. This is an introductory tutorial, so the fractions you add and subtract have the same denominators.

title: Subtracting decimals: standard algorithm
description: Just like with adding decimals, the key to subtracting decimals is aligning the decimal points. Let's practice!

title: Evaluating expressions
description: Learn to evaluate all sorts of expressions: expressions with one variable, two variables, fractions and decimals, and even expressions in word problems.

title: Evaluating expressions word problems
description: Learn how to plug in values to evaluate real-world expressions.

title: Mixed numbers
description: Learn how to write improper fractions as mixed numbers (and mixed numbers as improper fractions).

title: Multiplication, division word problem: pedaling
description: Using multiplication and division to make estimates. Easy? Maybe, but what's more important is that you try.

title: Adding and subtracting decimals word problems
description: In this tutorial, we practice solving word problems by adding and subtracting decimal numbers.

title: Evaluating expressions review
description: An algebraic expression like 3x can be evaluated for any value of x. Say x=4, then 3x = 3*4 = 12. In this article, we review how to evaluate algebraic expressions.

title: Adding and subtracting fractions with unlike denominators word problems
description: Practice solving word problems by adding and subtracting fractions that have different denominators.

title: Multiplying decimals
description: The real world is seldom about whole numbers. If you precisely measure anything, you're likely to get a decimal. If you don't know how to multiply these decimals, then you won't be able to do all the powerful things that multiplication can do in the real world (figure out your commission as a robot possum salesperson, determining how much shag carpet you need for your secret lair, etc.).

title: Writing algebraic expressions introduction
description: Learn the basics of writing expressions with variables.

title: Mixed number or improper fraction on a number line
description: Fraction or mixed number...either way you should end up on the same spot on the number line. Give it a try with us.

title: Adding and subtracting mixed numbers
description: Learn how to add and subtract mixed numbers. This is an introductory tutorial, so the fractions you add and subtract have the same denominators.

title: Algebraic equations basics
description: Explore what it means for equations with variables (algebraic equations) to be solved.

title: Multiplying decimals: standard algorithm
description: You've already multiplied decimals in the 5th grade. We'll show you some ways to handle slightly more complicated problems. Now you'll become super good at it with a bit more practice!  Common Core Standard: 6.NS.B.3

title: Why we do the same thing to both sides of an equation
description: A high-level, conceptual walk-through of what an equation represents and why we do the same thing to both sides of it

title: Visually adding and subtracting fractions with unlike denominators
description: An introduction to adding and subtracting fractions with unlike denominators that uses visual fraction models

title: Writing expressions
description: Learn to write algebraic expressions in and out of word problems.

title: Introduction to equivalent algebraic expressions
description: Learn to tell whether or not two algebraic expressions are equivalent by combining like terms and using the distributive property.

title: Adding and subtracting fractions with unlike denominators
description: Learn how to add and subtract fractions that have different denominators.

title: Dividing decimals
description: In this tutorial, we'll extend our division skills to include decimals! We get into some pretty fun stuff here including dividing decimals by whole numbers, and dividing whole numbers by decimals. Finally...dividing decimals by decimals.  Common Core Standard 5.NBT.B.7

title: One-step addition & subtraction equations
description: Solve equations by adding and subtracting numbers from both sides.

title: Dependent & independent variables
description: Sometimes one variable depends on another. For example, the amount of money you make might depend on how many hours you work.

title: One-step multiplication & division equations
description: Solve equations by multiplying and dividing numbers from both sides.

title: Adding and subtracting mixed number with unlike denominators
description: Learn how to add and subtract mixed numbers whose fractional parts have different denominators.

title: Combining like terms
description: Learn how to combine like terms (with negative numbers and variables), including more complex problems involving the distributive property.

title: Dividing decimals: standard algorithm
description: Learn long division with decimals. Solve problems like 30.24 divided by 0.42.

title: Two-steps equations intro
description: Learn how to solve equations like 2x+7=13 and 3(x+4)=3, which can be solved in two steps.

title: Combining like terms review
description: A common technique for simplifying algebraic expressions. When combining like terms, such as 2x and 3x, we add their coefficients. For example, 2x + 3x = (2+3)x = 5x.

title: Significant figures
description:
There is a strong temptation in life to appear precise, even when you are aren't accurate.   If you  precisely measure one dimension of a carpet to be 3.256 meters and eyeball the other dimensional to be "roughly 2 meters", can you really claim that the area is  6.512 square meters (3.256 x 2)?  Isn't that a little misleading?  

This tutorial gets us thinking about this conundrum and gives us the best practices that scientists and engineers use to not mislead each other.

title: Multiplying unit fractions and whole numbers
description: Learn how to multiply unit fractions and whole numbers.

title: Interpreting linear expressions
description: Any expression (mathematical or otherwise) has meaning. Help us match the linear expression to the meaning options given. In some cases, more than one meaning may apply.

title: Describing steps when solving equations
description: Sal lists the steps necessary in order to solve a linear equation. This is useful for thinking more strategically about equations.

title: Intro to significant figures
description: Significant figures refers to the number of important single digits in a value, often a measurement.  This video is an introduction to significant figures.

title: Multiplying whole numbers and fractions
description: Learn the art of multiplying whole numbers by fractions. See how 3 times 2/3 is the same as 6 times 1/3, which is the same as 6/3.

title: Rules of significant figures
description: Learn the "rules of thumb" for significant figures.

title: Two-step equation word problems
description: Learn how to set up and solve equations to find answers to real-world questions.

title: Addition and subtraction with significant figures
description: Learn to add and subtract with significant figures.

title: Irrational numbers
description: Learn what irrational numbers are. Also learn how to classify numbers as whole, integer, rational, and irrational.

title: Multiplying and dividing with significant figures
description: Learn to multiply and divide with significant figures.

title: Significant figures
description: Determine how many significant figures a given number has.

title: Multiplication as scaling
description: Learn to see multiplication as a way to grow (scale up) and shrink (scale down) other numbers.

title: Linear equations with variables on both sides
description: Learn how to solve linear equations that have the variable on both sides of the equation. For example, solve 2x+5=6x-3.

title: Square roots and real numbers (old)
description: An old video of Sal where he simplifies square roots in order to determine whether they represent rational or irrational numbers.

title: Multiplying mixed numbers
description: Learn how to multiply mixed numbers.

title: Sums and products of rational and irrational numbers
description: Determine whether various combinations of rational and irrational numbers are rational or irrational themselves.

title: Multiplying fractions
description: Learn how to multiply a fraction by a fraction.

title: Two-variable linear equations intro
description: Understand what a solution to an equation really means. Practice plugging in values for variables to see whether or not an equation is true.

title: Linear equations with parentheses
description: Learn how to solve linear equations with parentheses using the distributive property. For example, solve -9 - (9x - 6) = 3(4x + 6).

title: Solutions to 2-variable equations: substitution (old)
description: An old video of Sal checking whether (3,-4) is a solution of 5x+2y=7 by substituting x=3 and y=-4.

title: Proofs concerning irrational numbers
description: Learn some proofs about the existence of irrational numbers.

title: Solutions to 2-variable equations: graphical (old)
description: An old video of Sal checking whether (3,-4) is a solution of 5x+2y=7 by graphing the equation and checking if (3,-4) is on the line.

title: x-intercepts and y-intercepts
description: Learn about intercepts and practice finding them from graphs, tables, and equations.

title: Division by zero
description: Sal uses algebraic reasoning to tackle the problems of dividing by zero.

title: Analyzing the number of solutions to linear equations
description: Linear equations can either have a single solution, infinite solutions, or no solutions. Learn how to determine the number of solutions to a given equation, and how to create equations with a desired number of solutions.

title: Multiplying fractions word problems
description: Get some practice solving word problems by multiplying fractions.

title: Binary and hexadecimal number systems
description: Most of us are used to using the digits 0-9 to represent numbers in the base-10 (decimal)number system.  In this tutorial, we'll see that is just one of many (really infinite) number systems.  In particular, we will focus on the binary (base-2) and hexadecimal (base-16) systems.

title: Introduction to number systems and binary
Multiplying fractions word problem: pumpkin pie
description: Oops! Someone tried to solve this problem and made a mistake. See if you can spot the error.

title: Graphing using intercepts (old)
description: An old video of Sal where he draws the line y=3x-9 by finding its x- and y-intercetps.

title: Linear equations word problems
description: Solve word problems by creating linear equations and solving them.

title: Fractions as division
description: **Spoiler Alert!** The fraction bar and the division symbol are really saying the same thing.

title: Converting larger number from decimal to binary
Converting from decimal to hexadecimal representation
Linear equations with unknown coefficients
description: An equation like ax+3x=bx+5 can still be solved for x even though some of the coefficients are variables.

title: Dividing unit fractions by whole numbers
description: Learn how to divide unit fractions by whole numbers. Example: 1/5 ÷ 3 = 1/15.

title: Converting directly from binary to hexadecimal
Interpreting function notation
description: Solve some word problems by interpreting expressions of modeling functions.

title: Long division of polynomials
description: Learn how to divide two polynomials using long division.

title: Quadrants on the coordinate plane
description: Learn the 4 quadrants of a coordinate plane.

title: How to count to 1000 on two hands
description: Typically when we think of counting on two hands, we count up to 10, but fingers can contain much more information than that! This video shows how to think about counting in binary. Music: "Sun Will Set" by Zoe Keating

title: Old school equations with Sal
description: Some of Sal's oldest (and roughest) videos on algebra.  Great tutorial if you want to see what Khan Academy was like around 2006.  You might also like it if you feel like Sal has lost his magic now that he doesn't use the cheapest possible equipment to make the videos.

title: Linear equations 1
description: equations of the form AX=B

title: Horizontal & vertical lines
description: You know what horizontal and vertical lines are, but how do their equations look? And what is their slope? Learn all about it in this tutorial.

title: Dividing whole numbers by unit fractions
description: Learn how to divide whole numbers by unit fractions. Example: 4 ÷ 1/3 = 12.

title: Linear equations 2
description: solving equations of the form AX+B=C

title: Linear equations 3
description: Linear equations with multiple variable and constant terms

title: Dividing fractions by fractions
description: Learn how to divide fractions by other fractions.

title: Intro to slope-intercept form
description: Make an introduction with the most common form of linear equations, slope-intercept form! For example, y=3x+5 is a linear equation in slope-intercept form.

title: Linear equations 4
description: Solving linear equations with variable expressions in the denominators of fractions

title: Introduction to arithmetic sequences
description: Learn about arithmetic sequences and their main features, the initial term and the common difference. Evaluate arithmetic sequences.

title: Averages
description: Introduction to averages and algebra problems involving averages.

title: Taking percentages
description: Taking a percentage of a number.

title: Graphing slope-intercept equations
description: Learn how to graph linear equations that are given in slope-intercept form. For example, graph y=2x+3.

title: More percent problems
description: Slightly harder percent problems

title: Solving an equation for a variable
description: Sal solves the equation P=2I+2w for the variable I.

title: Dividing fractions word problems
description: Practice solving word problems with fraction division.

title: Introduction to inequalities with variables
description: Algebraic inequalities (inequalities with variables) are useful for describing real-world situations. Learn how to write inequalities and graph them on the number line.

title: Constructing arithmetic sequences
description: Learn how to find the explicit or recursive formula of an arithmetic sequence.

title: Writing slope-intercept equations
description: Learn how to write the equation of a line (in slope-intercept form) when given the graph of the equation or two points on the line. For example, write the equation of the line that passes through the points (0,1) and (5,4).

title: Systems of equations overview
description: This video series covers everything you need to know about systems of equations, through stories about trolls, kings, and cupcakes!

title: One-step inequalities
description: Learn how to solve (mathematical) inequalities. A key concept in this tutorial is flipping the inequality sign when multiplying or dividing both sides by a negative number.

title: Slope-intercept equation from slope & point (old)
description: An old video where Sal finds the slope-intercept form of a line that has a slope of 7 and goes through the point (-4,-11).

title: One-step inequality involving addition
description: One-Step Inequalities

title: Slope-intercept equation from slope & point: fractions (old)
description: An old video where Sal finds the slope-intercept form of a line that has a slope of ⅓ and goes through the point (-12,-14/3).

title: Finding y intercept given slope & point (old)
description: An old video where Sal finds the y-intercept of the line y=17/13x+b given that the line passes through (5,8).

title: Introduction to systems of equations
description: Learn what "systems of equations" are, what counts as a solution to such a system, and how we can use graphs to solve them.

title: Introduction to geometric sequences
description: Learn about geometric sequences and their main features, the initial term and the common ratio. Evaluate geometric sequences.

title: Inequalities using addition and subtraction
description: Inequalities Using Addition and Subtraction

title: Two-step inequalities
description: Learn how to solve more complex (mathematical) inequalities. Also learn to construct inequalities to model real-world situations.

title: Equivalent systems of equations and the elimination method
description: Learn about the elimination method, which is a way manipulate systems of equations in order to solve them algebraically. This is actually very similar to the way we manipulate single equations in order to solve them!

title: Constructing geometric sequences
description: Learn how to find the explicit or recursive formula of a geometric sequence.

title: Multi-step inequalities
description: Solve any possible linear inequality in one variable. For example, solve -3x-7<x+9.

title: Summary: Forms of two-variable linear equations
description: Take an overview of the three main forms of linear equations: slope-intercept, point-slope, and standard. Learn which form is most appropriate for different uses.

title: Compound inequalities
description: Learn how to solve compound inequalities. For example, solve 2x+1>3 AND -x-5<4.

title: Translations
description: Learn how to find the translation that maps a given figure to another, and how to manually draw the image of a translation.

title: Modeling with sequences
description: Now that we've mastered arithmetic and geometric sequences, let's see how they can help us solve real-world word problems. In this tutorial you will find the formula for a sequence that models a real-world relationship.

title: Solving systems of equations by elimination (old)
description: An old video where Sal introduces the elimination method for systems of linear equations.

title: General sequences
description: Arithmetic and geometric sequences are very useful, but they are definitely not the only kinds of sequences out there. Let's zoom out and consider some other kinds of sequences.

title: Interpreting linear functions and equations
description: Solve word problems where you need to answer a question about a real-world relationship based on its mathematical model.

title: Solving systems of equations with substitution
description: Learn about the substitution method, which is another way to manipulate systems of equations in order to solve them.

title: Checking solutions of two-variable inequalities
description: Learn how to check possible solutions of two-variable linear inequalities. For example, is (2, 0) a solution to y>x+1? In this tutorial, we also check solutions to systems of inequalities.

title: Solving linear systems by substitution (old)
description: An old video where Sal introduces the substitution method for systems of linear equations.

title: Evaluating functions
description: Learn how to find the value of a function for a given input value.

title: Manipulating expressions with unknown variables
description: Learn how to rewrite expressions with variables whose values are unknown, by using another information about those variables. For example, given that a+b=0, express a*b in terms of b alone.

title: Comparing linear functions
description: Compare features of linear functions, such as slope and intercepts, where the functions are given in different forms—tables, graphs, or formulas.

title: Constraining solutions of two-variable inequalities
description: Given a specific value for one of the variables in a two-variable linear inequality (or system of inequalities), learn how to find the corresponding range of values for the other variable. For example, given that x=3, what are the possible values for y in 2x+y<1 ?

title: Constraining solutions of two-variable inequalities
description: Sal determines which x-values make the ordered pair (x,-7) a solution of 2x-7y<25, both algebraically and graphically.

title: New operator definitions 2
description: Worked examples of working with more newly defined operators.

title: Angles in circles
description: Learn how to measure angles using a circle protractor and solve word problems about angles as part of a circle.

title: Alien abduction brain teaser
description: Saving Earth from becoming a mushroom farm.

title: Transformation Puzzles
description: Random puzzles involving rotating, reflecting, and dilating polygons.

title: Thanksgiving math
description: Mathed potatoes, Borromean onion rings, green bean matheroles and Turduckenen-duckenen (yes, you read that right)

title: How was our Solar System formed?
Number of solutions to systems of equations
description: Learn about the possible number of solutions of systems of linear equations. Spoiler: There can be a single solution, zero solutions, or infinite solutions. These different cases define the distinctions between "consistent" and "inconsistent" systems, and between "dependent" and "independent" systems.

title: Constraint solutions of two-variable inequalities
description: Find the range of values of one variable that corresponds to a given value of the other variable in a linear inequality.

title: Inputs and outputs of a function
description: Extend your understanding of the relationship between the inputs of a function and the outputs of that function.

title: Constraining solutions of systems of inequalities
description: Given the graph of a system of inequalities, Sal finds the x-values that make the ordered pair (x,-2) a solution of the system.

title: Constraint solutions of systems of inequalities
description: Find the range of values of one variable that corresponds to a given value of the other variable in a system of two-variable linear inequalities.

title: Graphing two-variable inequalities
description: Learn how to graph two-variables linear inequalities and systems of two-variable linear inequalities.

title: Constructing linear models for real-world relationships
description: Learn how to represent real-world relationships (that are described verbally) with linear graphs, equations, or functions.

title: Functions and equations
description: Understand the subtle differences and similarities between functions and equations. In this exercise, we will see how an equation can be turned into a function.

title: Solving any system of linear equations
description: Use everything you learned so far in order to solve any kind of system of equations!

title: Systems of equations word problems
description: Now that we are able to solve any kind of system we are given, it's time to use that knowledge to solve some word problems.

title: Graphing two-variable inequalities (old)
description: An old video where Sal graphs the inequality y-4x<-3.

title: Linear models word problems
description: Solve general word problems about real-world relationships that can be modeled by linear equations or functions.

title: Introduction to the domain and range of a function
description: Learn what the domain and the range of a function are. Practice finding the domain and the range of a function given its graph.

title: Modeling with linear inequalities
description: Learn how to construct linear inequalities and systems of inequalities given a real-life context. Learn how to interpret such inequalities in terms of a real-life context, either algebraically or graphically.

title: Graphs of absolute value functions
description: Learn how to graph absolute value functions like f(x)=|x+2|-8.

title: Determining the domain of a function
description: Determine the domains of functions according to various considerations.

title: Solving equations by graphing (Algebra 2 level)
description: Learn how to approximate the solution to any equation by using the power of graphs.

title: The golden ratio
description: Explore a very famous and useful ratio.

title: Recognizing functions
description: Learn how to distinguish between two-variable relationships that are functions and two-variable relationships that aren't functions.

title: Solving absolute value equations
description: Learn how to solve absolute-value equations. For example, solve 2|x-1|=5.

title: Intro to absolute value equations and graphs
description: Absolute value equations are equations where the variable is within an absolute value operator, like |x-5|=9. The challenge is that the absolute value of a number depends on the number's sign: if it's positive, it's equal to the number: |9|=9. If the number is negative, then the absolute value is its opposite: |-9|=9. So when we're dealing with a variable, we need to consider both cases.

title: Worked example: absolute value equation with two solutions
description: Solving the equation 8|x+7|+4 = -6|x+7|+6 which has two possible solutions.

title: Worked example: absolute value equations with one solution
description: Solving the equation |3x-9|=0 which has a single possible solution.

title: Worked example: absolute value equations with no solution
description: Solving the equation 4|x+10|+4 = 6|x+10|+10 to find that it has no possible solution.

title: Solve absolute value equations
description: Solve equations like 3|x+1| + 7 = 6|x+1| + 6.

title: Systems with three variables
description: Learn how to make the most out of the familiar algebraic techniques in order to solve systems of three equations with three variables.

title: Parabolas intro
description: Learn what parabolas are and about their main features: their general shape, vertex, and axis of symmetry.

title: Piecewise functions
description: Piecewise functions are functions that have different assignment rules for different numbers. For example, a function can return x² for any negative x-value and return x³ for any non-negative x-value.

title: Solving absolute value inequalities
description: Learn how to solve absolute value inequalities. For example, solve |x-12|+4<14.

title: Intro to absolute value inequalities
description: Sal introduces the concept of inequalities that contain absolute value expressions, and solves a bunch of examples.

title: Quadratic factored form
description: The factored form of a quadratic function is an expression that is, well, factored! Like f(x)=(2x+1)(x-3). Learn how to analyze functions given in this form to find their zeros, their vertex, and their graph.

title: Solving absolute value inequalities 1
description: Sal solves the inequality |h|-19.5 < -12.

title: Solving absolute value inequalities 2
description: Sal solves the inequality |p-12|+4 < 14.

title: Solving absolute value inequalities: fractions
description: Sal solves the inequality |2r-3 1/4| < 2 1/2.

title: Solving absolute value inequalities: no solution
description: Sal solves the inequality |y|+22 ≤ 13.5 to find that it has no solution.

title: Absolute value inequalities word problem
description: Sal solves a word problem about a carpenter by writing an appropriate absolute value inequality and solving it.

title: Maximum and minimum points
description: Learn about maximum and minimum points of functions.

title: Intro to polynomials
description: Learn about polynomial expressions: What are they? How are they constructed? What can we do with them?

title: Solving quadratics by taking square roots
description: In this tutorial you will learn about the most basic way of solving quadratic equations.

title: Intervals where a function is positive, negative, increasing, or decreasing
description: Learn about features of functions that have distinct graphical representations: intervals where the function is always positive or always negative, and intervals where the function is always increasing or always decreasing.

title: Adding & subtracting polynomials
description: Learn how to add and subtract polynomial expressions with one variable.

title: Exponent properties review
description: Practice using the exponent properties to rewrite powers, where the exponent is an integer that can either be positive or negative.

title: Interpreting features of graphs
description: Interpret the graphs of functions in terms of the contexts that are modeled by the functions.

title: Solving quadratics by taking square roots: challenge
description: Sal solves challenging quadratic equations like (4x+1)²-8=0 by taking the square root of both sides.

title: Average rate of change
description: Learn what's the average rate of change of a function and how to find it over given intervals.

title: Radicals
description: Radicals (also known as roots) are a generalization of square roots. They are the inverse operation of any power. For example, the 5th root of 32 is 2, because 2⁵=32.

title: Quadratic vertex form
description: The vertex form of a quadratic function shows the coordinates of the parabola's vertex. For example, the vertex of g(x)=(x-1)²+2 is at (1,2). Learn how to analyze functions given in this form to find their zeros, their vertex, and their graph.

title: Adding polynomials (old)
description: An old video where Sal adds (5x²+8x-3) + (2x² - 7x + 13x).

title: Adding & subtracting polynomials: two variables
description: Learn how to add and subtract polynomial that involve two variables. For example, x^3 + xy + 3y - (x^3 + 6xy + 2y^2).

title: Average rate of change word problems
description: Solve word problems that concern the average rate of change of a functional relationship.

title: Solving quadratics by factoring
description: In this tutorial, you'll learn some pretty elaborate ways of solving quadratic equations, by harnessing the mighty strength of algebra.

title: Rational exponents intro
description: Learn the definition for raising a number by a fractional exponent, like 8^⅔.

title: Combining functions
description: Learn how to take two basic functions and combine them into a new function which is their sum, difference, product, or quotient.

title: Multiplying monomials
description: As an intro to more elaborate polynomial multiplication, learn how to multiply monomials (which are polynomials with a single term). For example, multiply 2x³ and 5x⁷.

title: Solving quadratic equations by factoring (old)
description: An old video where Sal solves a bunch of quadratic equations by using factorization methods.

title: Properties of exponents (rational exponents)
description: In this tutorial you will rewrite variable expressions with rational exponents using the properties of exponents.

title: Completing the square
description: You're already familiar with factoring quadratics, but have begun to realize that it only is useful in certain cases.  Well, this tutorial will introduce you to something far more powerful and general.  Even better, it is the bridge to understanding and proving the famous quadratic formula.

title: Multiplying monomials by polynomials
description: Learn how to multiply a polynomial expression by a monomial expression. Monomials are just polynomials with a single term!

title: Composing functions (Algebra 2 level)
description: Learn what function composition is, how to to work with composite functions, and how to find the formulas of the composition of two functions.

title: Advanced exponent & radical evaluation
description: Evaluate elaborate expressions that contain radicals and fractional exponents.

title: Multiplying binomials
description: Learn how to multiply two binomials together. For example, (3x - 7) * (10x + 2).

title: Simplifying square roots
description: We know how to evaluate square roots of perfect squares. For example, √16=4. What about the other square roots? It's harder to give an exact number, but we can simplify them so we have a better understanding of their value. For example, √32=4⋅√2. Learn more about it in this tutorial.

title: The quadratic formula
description: Learn how to solve any quadratic equation with the most general tool of all, the quadratic formula!

title: Shifting functions
description: Learn how to transform functions so their graph is shifted horizontally or vertically. Learn how to find the equation of a function that is a shift of another function.

title: Simplifying radicals (higher-index roots)
description: Just like we can simplify square roots, we can simplify other radicals. This tutorial covers the simplification of higher-index roots. For example, ∜48=2⋅∜3.

title: Stretching functions
description: Learn how to transform functions so their graph is stretched horizontally or vertically. Learn how to find the equation of a function that is a stretch of another function.

title: Special products of binomials
description: Learn about the special types of products of binomials: perfect squares and the difference of two squares. These will be very helpful once you tackle more advanced expressions in Algebra.

title: Radicals (miscellaneous videos)
description: Various videos we have that cover advanced/special skills related to radical expressions.

title: Modeling situations by combining and composing functions (Algebra 2 level)
description: Make use of knowledge in combining and composing functions, by modeling complex real-world situations.

title: Simplifying rational exponent expressions: mixed exponents and radicals
description: Sal simplifies v^(-6/5)* ⁵√v as v^(-1).

title: Simplifying square-root expressions: no variables (advanced)
description: Sal simplifies elaborate expressions with square roots. For example, he simplifies (4√20-3√45)/√35 as -√(1/7).

title: Squaring a binomial (old)
description: An old video where Sal expands and simplifies (7x+10)².

title: Intro to rationalizing the denominator
description: When we have a fraction with a root in the denominator, like 1/√2, it's often desirable to manipulate it so the denominator doesn't have roots. To do that, we can multiply both the numerator and the denominator by the same root, that will get rid of the root in the denominator. For example, we can multiply 1/√2 by √2/√2 to get √2/2

title: Quadratic standard form
description: In this tutorial, we will learn how to graph quadratic functions given in different forms.

title: Worked example: rationalizing the denominator
description: Sal rationalizes the denominator of the expression (16+2x²)/(√8).

title: Introduction to inverses of functions (Algebra 2 level)
description: Learn what inverses of functions are, and gain some experience with them by finding the outputs of the inverse of a function given that function.

title: Multiplying binomials by polynomials
description: Learn how to multiply a polynomial expression by a binomial expression.

title: Simplifying radical expressions (addition)
description: A worked example of simplifying an expression that is a sum of several radicals. In this example, we simplify √(2x²)+4√8+3√(2x²)+√8.

title: Simplifying radical expressions (subtraction)
description: Sal simplifies 4∜(81x⁵)-2∜(81x⁵)-√(x³).

title: Simplifying radical expressions: two variables
description: A worked example of simplifying elaborate expressions that contain radicals with two variables. In this example, we simplify √(60x²y)/√(48x).

title: Simplifying radical expressions: three variables
description: A worked example of simplifying the cube root of 27a²b⁵c³ using the properties of exponents.

title: Features & forms of quadratic functions
description: Learn about the features of quadratic functions, and how to find them given the formula of the function. Also learn about the different forms of quadratic functions: standard, vertex, and factored.

title: Finding inverse functions (Algebra 2 level)
description: Learn how to find the inverses of polynomials functions, radical functions, and rational functions.

title: 2003 AIME II problem 13
description: Probability of moving to a vertex

title: Multiplying binomials by polynomials (old)
description: An old video where Sal gives several examples of polynomial multiplication.

title: Simplifying hairy expression with fractional exponents
description: Sal simplifies hairy expressions with rational exponents. For example, he simplifies (125^-⅛*125^⅝)/(5^½) as 5.

title: Multiplying binomials with radicals (old)
description: An old video Where Sal multiplies and simplifies (x²-√6)(x²+√2).

title: Exponential vs. linear growth
description: Learn about exponential growth and decay, and specifically how it always grows (or diminishes) by equal factors.

title: Polynomials word problems
description: See a few examples of how we can represent real-world situations with polynomials.

title: Verifying that functions are inverses (Algebra 2 level)
description: Learn how to check whether a pair of functions are the inverses of one another.

title: Introduction to factorization
description: Learn what factorization is all about, and warm-up by factoring some monomials.

title: Exponential expressions
description: Learn how to construct exponential functions to model real-world situations.

title: Transforming parabolas
description: Learn how function transformations affect the graphs of quadratic functions.

title: Determining whether a function is invertible (Algebra 2 level)
description: Learn about the conditions for a function to be invertible, and learn how to manipulate functions to make them invertible.

title: Factoring monomials
description: Learn how to write a monomial as a factor of two other monomials. For example, write 12x^3 as (4x)(3x^2).

title: Systems of quadratic equations
description: Learn how to solve systems of two equations in two variables, where at least one of the equations is quadratic.

title: Graphs of exponential growth
description: Learn how an exponential function behaves as the value of its input increases to positive infinity or decreases to negative infinity. Learn how to graph basic exponential functions.

title: Determining the domain of advanced functions (Algebra 2 level)
description: Learn how to determine the domain of piecewise functions with different function rules.

title: Domain of advanced functions
description: Sal covers many different kinds of functions and shows how to determine their domain.

title: Domain of advanced functions
description: Determine the domain of functions whose expressions are a combination of different types of assignment rules.

title: Introduction to rate of exponential growth and decay
description: Learn about different ways of describing the rate of change of exponential functions.

title: Rate conversion
description: Practice solving word problems that involve the conversion between different units for the same quantity. For example, a rate problem where some rates are in km/h and some are in m/s.

title: What are the imaginary numbers?
description: Learn about the imaginary unit i (which is the square root of -1) and about imaginary numbers like 3i (which is the square root of -9).

title: Introduction to symmetry of functions
description: You may already be familiar with types of symmetries of geometrical shapes. Learn how functions can be symmetrical too!

title: Domain of advanced piecewise functions
description: Determine the domain of piecewise functions whose assignment rules have different expression types.

title: Factoring polynomials by taking common factors
description: Learn how to take a common monomial factor out of a polynomial expression. For example, write 2x^3+6x^2+8x as (2x)(x^2+3x+4).

title: Exponential vs. linear growth over time
description: Learn how to  distinguish between linear and exponential growth, and learn the differences between the end behavior of polynomial and exponential functions.

title: Quadratic inequalities
description: Learn how to solve inequalities that contain quadratic expressions. For instance, solve x^2+3x+2>0.

title: Determining the range of a function (Algebra 2 level)
description: Learn how to find the range of a function, which is the set of all of the function's possible outputs.

title: Quadratic inequalities
description: Sal solves x^2+3x>10.

title: Domain and range of quadratic functions
description: Sal finds the domain and the range of f(x)=3x^2+6x-2.

title: Exponential decay
description: Learn how to construct exponential functions and then analyze them to model and solve real-world problems.

title: Quadratic inequalities (example 2)
description: Sal solves -x(2x-14)≥24.

title: Range of quadratic functions
description: Learn how you can find the range of any quadratic function from its vertex form.

title: Quadratic inequalities: graphical approach
description: Sal solves a few quadratic inequalities by moving all terms to one side of the inequality and graphing the resulting expression.

title: Range of quadratic functions
description: Given the equation of a quadratic function, determine its range.

title: Graphing nonlinear piecewise functions (Algebra 2 level)
description: Learn how to graph piecewise functions whose assignment rules are not linear.

title: Graphs of nonlinear piecewise functions
description: Sal is given the graph of a piecewise function and several possible formulas. He determines which is the correct formula.

title: Graphs of nonlinear piecewise functions
description: Given the graph of a nonlinear piecewise function, find its formula.

title: Factoring polynomials: common factor (old)
description: An old video where Sal factors 20u²v - 10uv² as 10uv(2u-v).

title: Exponential functions from tables & graphs
description: Learn how to analyze the formulas of basic exponential functions in order to find their common ratio, initial value, and other parameters.

title: Solving square-root equations
description: Learn how to solve equations with square-root expressions in them. For example, solve √(2x-5)=√(7-3x).

title: Interpreting the symmetry of algebraic models (Algebra 2 level)
description: Learn how to interpret graphs of modeling functions in terms of their context by considering their symmetry.

title: Factoring polynomials: common factor (old)
description: An old video where Sal factors 4x⁴y+8x³y as 4x³y(x+2).

title: Evaluating expressions with unknown variables
description: Learn how to evaluate expressions with variables whose values are unknown, by using another information about those variables. For example, given that a+b=3, evaluate 4a+4b.

title: Interpreting the end behavior of algebraic models (Algebra 2 level)
description: Learn how to interpret graphs of modeling functions in terms of their context by considering their end behavior.

title: Factoring quadratics intro
description: Learn how to factor quadratic expressions with a leading coefficient of 1. For example, factor x²+3x+2 as (x+1)(x+2).

title: Interpreting the periodicity of algebraic models (Algebra 2 level)
description: Learn how to interpret graphs of modeling functions in terms of their context by considering their periodicity.

title: Equivalent forms of exponential expressions
description: Learn how to manipulate exponential expressions in different ways. For example, rewrite 8^x as 2^(3x).

title: Comparing features of functions (Algebra 2 level)
description: Learn how to compare various features between two functions, each represented in a different way.

title: Extraneous solutions of radical equations
description: Learn about the conditions for obtaining extraneous solutions while solving radical equations.

title: Factoring quadratics by grouping
description: Learn how to factor quadratic expressions with a leading coefficient other than 1. For example, factor 2x²+7x+3 as (2x+1)(x+3).

title: Solving exponential equations using properties of exponents
description: Learn how to solve advanced exponential equations by manipulating the expressions in the equations using the properties of exponents. For example, solve 2^(x+1)=8^x by rewriting 8^x as 2^(3x) and then equating x+1=3x.

title: Two-variable functions
description: Learn about functions that take *two* inputs in order to output a single value.

title: Solving cube-root equations
description: Learn how to solve equations with cube-root expressions in them. For example, solve ∛(2-6x)=x+3.

title: New operator definitions 1
description: Sal solves a few problems where a new operator is defined and Sal evaluates some expression with it.

title: New operator definitions 1
description: Given the definition of a new operator, evaluate an expression that contains that operator.

title: Domain of radical functions
description: Learn how the domain of radical functions is determined.

title: Graphs of radical functions
description: Learn how the graphs of radical functions look, and how we can reason about them using function transformations (i.e. shifts, stretches, etc.).

title: Factoring polynomials with quadratic forms
description: Learn how to factor quadratic polynomials of the form ax^2+bx+c as the product of two linear binomials. For example, write x^2+3x-10 as (x+5)(x-2). Learn how to identify these forms in more elaborate polynomials that aren't necessarily quadratic. For example, write x^4-4x^2-12 as (x^2+2)(x^2-6).

title: New operator definitions 2
description: Given the definition of two new operators, evaluate an expression that contains that operator.

title: Interpreting the rate of change of exponential models (Algebra 2 level)
description: Learn how to analyze exponential modeling functions in order to find their rate of change.

title: Constructing exponential models according to rate of change (Algebra 2 level)
description: Learn how to find the modeling function of an exponential real world context, according to the description of its rate of change.

title: Factoring quadratics with common factor (old)
description: An old video where Sal factors 8k²-24k-144 by first taking out a common factor of 8 and then using the sum-product pattern.

title: Intro to rational expressions
description: Learn what rational expressions are and about the values for which they are undefined.

title: Factoring quadratics: Difference of squares
description: Learn how to factor quadratics that have the "difference of squares" form. For example, write x²-16 as (x+4)(x-4). Learn how to identify this form in more elaborate expressions. For example, write 4x²-49 as (2x+7)(2x-7).

title: Introduction to radians
description: Learn about radians, which are the official unit of measurement for angles in algebra (in contrast to degrees, which are used in geometry).

title: Simplifying rational expressions
description: Learn how to simplify rational expressions by canceling factors that are shared by the numerator and the denominator. Sometimes this calls for factoring the numerator and the denominator in various ways.

title: Advanced interpretation of exponential models (Algebra 2 level)
description: Learn how to interpret an exponential modeling function by first manipulating it according to your needs. For example, rewrite 5^(2x+1) as 5*25^x to find that the unit growth factor is 25.

title: Factoring quadratics: Perfect squares
description: Learn how to factor quadratics that have the "perfect square" form. For example, write x²+6x+9 as (x+3)². Learn how to identify these forms in more elaborate expressions. For example, write 4x²+28x+49 as (2x+7)².

title: The unit circle definition of sine, cosine, & tangent
description: Learn how the trigonometric ratios are extended to all real numbers using algebra. Start solving simple problems that involve this new definition of the trigonometric functions.

title: Distinguishing between linear and exponential growth (Algebra 2 level)
description: Learn how to analyze real-world quantitative relationships given as tables of values to determine whether they represent linear growth or exponential growth.

title: The graphs of sine, cosine, & tangent
description: Learn how the graphs of y=sin(θ), y=cos(θ), and y=tan(θ) look, using the unit circle definition of the functions.

title: Introduction to logarithms (Algebra 2 level)
description: Learn how we define logarithms and use this definition in order to evaluate various logarithms. For example, evaluate log_2(8) as 3 by realizing that 2^3=8.

title: Multiplying & dividing rational expressions
description: Learn how to multiply and divide rational expressions. You will be surprised to see how similar it is to multiplying and dividing fractions!

title: Basic trigonometric identities
description: Learn about very useful trigonometric identities that arise by considering different properties of the unit circle definition.

title: Strategy in factoring quadratics
description: There are a lot of methods to factor quadratics, which apply on different occasions and conditions. Now that we know all of them, let's think strategically about which of them is useful for a given quadratic expression we want to factor.

title: Trigonometric values of special angles
description: Learn how to find the trigonometric values of some special angles without the use of a calculator.

title: Factoring polynomials with special product forms
description: Factor polynomials of various degrees using factorization methods that are based on the special product forms "difference of squares" and "perfect squares." For example, factor 25x⁴-30x²+9 as (5x²-3)².

title: The constant e and the natural logarithm (Algebra 2 level)
description: Learn about a very special constant in math that has a pivotal role in the world of exponential and logarithmic function, the constant e.

title: Pythagorean identity
description: Prove the Pythagorean trigonometric identity for all real numbers and use it in order to solve problems.

title: Properties of logarithms (Algebra 2 level)
description: Learn about special properties of logarithms that help us rewrite logarithmic expressions in different equivalent (much like we use properties of exponents to rewrite exponential expressions!).

title: Adding & subtracting rational expressions
description: Learn how to add and subtract rational expressions. Like multiplication and division, this skill has a remarkable affinity to adding and subtracting fractions!

title: Introduction to amplitude, midline, & extrema of sinusoidal functions
description: Learn about very important features of sinusoidal functions: the amplitude and the midline. Learn how they relate to the extremum points of the function.

title: Synthetic division of polynomials
description: Learn how to divide polynomials using long division.

title: Finding amplitude & midline of sinusoidal functions from their formulas
description: Learn how to find the amplitude and the midline of the graph of a sinusoidal function from its formula. For example, find the amplitude and the midline of f(x)=3*sin(2x-1)+5.

title: Practice dividing polynomials with remainders
description: After learning about the different methods in which we can find the quotient and the remainder of two polynomials, gain some practice with actually performing polynomial division yourself.

title: Period of sinusoidal functions
description: Learn about the period of sinusoidal functions: how it relates to extremum points and the midline, and how to find it from the formula of the function. For example, find the period of f(x)=3*sin(2x-1)+5.

title: The change of base formula for logarithms (Algebra 2 level)
description: Learn how to rewrite any logarithmic expression in a different base. For example, rewrite log_2(3) as ln(3)/ln(2). This is very helpful for evaluating logarithms with a calculator, which only evaluates base-10 and base-e logarithms.

title: Graphing sinusoidal functions
description: Learn how to draw the graph of sinusoidal functions. For example, draw the graph of f(x)=-2*cos(πx)-7.

title: Polynomial Remainder Theorem
description: The polynomial remainder theorem allows us to easily determine whether a linear expression is a factor of a given polynomial. Learn exactly what the theorem means, practice using it, and learn about its proof.

title: Nested fractions
description: Learn how to simplify rational expressions that contain further rational expressions within their numerators or denominators.

title: Logarithmic equations (Algebra 2 level)
description: Learn how to solve equations that contain logarithmic expressions. For example, solve log(x)+log(3)=log(7).

title: Constructing sinusoidal functions
description: Learn how to find the formula of a sinusoidal function from its graph or a few selected features. Model real-world situations with sinusoidal functions.

title: Solving exponential equations with logarithms (Algebra 2 level)
description: Learn how to solve any exponential equation by using logarithms. For example, solve 2^x=3 by calculating log_2(3).

title: Solving rational equations
description: Learn how to solve equations that have a rational expression, or a few of those.

title: Binomial theorem
description: Learn how to expand powers of binomial expressions (which are polynomial expressions with exactly two terms). This is done using the binomial theorem!

title: The inverse trigonometric functions
description: Learn about the inverse functions of sine, cosine, and tangent, and how they are defined even though the functions are not really invertible. These functions will be very helpful when you will solve trigonometric equations.

title: Solving exponential models (Algebra 2 level)
description: Learn how to solve word problems that require exponential equations.

title: Understanding the binomial theorem
description: Now that you know how to use the binomial theorem in order to expand powers of binomial expressions, let's gain further insight into why this actually works!

title: Advanced polynomial factorization methods
description: Learn more ways to factor polynomials with degree higher than 2.

title: Graphs of exponential functions (Algebra 2 level)
description: Learn about the graphs of advanced exponential functions of the form y=a*b^(x+c)+d.

title: Direct and inverse variation
description: Learn about direct and inverse variation, which are two types of relationships between two quantities. Direct variation is simply a proportional relationship, but inverse variation is more complicated and interesting. Gain some experience with it before we dive deeper into the world of rational functions.

title: Solving basic sinusoidal equations
description: Learn how to solve equations of the form sin(x)=d or cos(x)=d where d is any number. For example, solve sin(x)=0.6.

title: Proving polynomial identities
description: Practice proving polynomial identities, using all the factorization and expansion methods you know.

title: Direct variation word problem: filling gas
description: Worked example: Model a context about filling gas with a direct variation equation.

title: Solving advanced sinusoidal equations
description: Learn how to solve equations of the form a*sin(bx+c)=d or a*cos(bx+c)=d where a, b, c, and d are any number. For example, solve 5*sin(2x-1)=3.

title: Polynomial identities with complex numbers
description: Prove more polynomial identities, this time including complex numbers!

title: Graphs of logarithmic functions (Algebra 2 level)
description: Learn about the graphs of logarithmic functions, and how they relate to graphs of exponential functions.

title: Direct variation word problem: space travel
description: Sal models a context about space travel with a direct variation equation.

title: Solving sinusoidal models
description: Solve word problems that involve sinusoidal modeling functions.

title: Proportionality constant for direct variation
description: Worked example: y is directly proportional to x, and y=30 when x=6. Find the value of x when y=45.

title: Quadratic equations with complex numbers
description: Remember all these quadratic equations with "no real solution"? Well, it turns out those equations do have a solution, it's just a complex number! Solve a bunch of those here.

title: End behavior of rational functions
description: Learn about the ways in which rational functions behave as x approaches positive or negative infinity. This gets interesting Learn how to determine this behavior for any kind of rational function.

title: Vertical asymptote of natural log
description: What happens to ln(x) as x approaches 0?

title: Foci of an ellipse
description: Learn about the foci of an ellipse, which are two points for which the sum of the distances from any point on the ellipse is constant.

title: The golden ratio
description: An introduction to one of the most amazing ideas/numbers in mathematics

title: Introduction to the trigonometric angle addition identities
description: Learn about the trigonometric angle addition identities, which help us discuss the trig values of sums of angles in terms of the trig values of the individual angles. For example, we can express sin(x+y) in terms of sin(x), sin(y), cos(x), and cos(y).

title: Logarithmic scale (Algebra 2 level)
description: Enrich your knowledge with some videos about logarithmic scales and how useful they are.

title: Fundamental Theorem of Algebra
description: You may already have noticed that quadratic equations always have a solution when including complex number solutions. It turns out this is true for any polynomial equation, of any degree! Learn about this and more, right here.

title: Discontinuities of rational functions
description: Learn about the ways in which rational functions behave when their denominator is equal to zero. This gets interesting when vertical asymptotes are involved! Learn how to determine this behavior for any kind of rational function.

title: Finding zeros of polynomials
description: Use all the knowledge you have about polynomials to find their zeros (which are the input values that make the polynomial equal to zero).

title: Graphs of rational functions
description: Combine your knowledge of intercepts, horizontal asymptotes, vertical asymptotes, and removable discontinuities, in order to analyze entire graphs of rational functions!

title: Using trigonometric identities to solve problems
description: Learn about different ways in which trigonometric identities, such as the Pythagorean identity and the angle addition identities, can be used to solve problems.

title: Zeros of polynomials and their graphs
description: Learn how to use the zeros of polynomials to draw a pretty good sketch of their graphs.

title: Parametric equations
description: Here we will explore representing our x's and y's in terms of a third variable or parameter (often 't').  Not only can we describe new things, but it can be super useful for describing things like particle motion in physics.

title: Appropriate units
description: Learn how to work with units that are arithmetic combinations of more simple units. For example, velocity units are quotients of distance units over time units, which corresponds to the formula v=d/t.

title: Removing the parameter in parametric equations
description: Sal starts with parametric equations that give x and y as functions of t, and he manipulates the equations to get y as a function of x.

title: Removing the parameter in parametric equations (example 2)
description: Sal is given x=3cost and y=2sint and he finds an equation that gives the relationship between x and y (spoiler: it's an ellipse!).

title: End behavior of polynomial functions
description: Learn about the end behavior of polynomial functions. End behavior is the way the function behaves as the input values grow infinitely positive or infinitely negative.

title: Parametric equations with the same graph
description: Sal shows how different parametric equations can result in the same relationship between x and y (and therefore with the same graph).

title: Modeling with rational functions
description: See some examples of how rational functions and equations can come in handy when solving real-world word problems.

title: Word problems with multiple units
description: Practice solving word problems that involve a variety of units.

title: Graphs of polynomials
description: Combine your knowledge about the zeros and the end behavior of a polynomial in order to sketch its graph.

title: Modeling with one-variable equations & inequalities
description: Learn how to determine the appropriate *type* of modeling equation (or inequality) according to the description of a real-world context.

title: Rational inequalities
description: Learn how to solve inequalities that contain rational expressions. For instance, solve (x-3)/(x+4)≥2.

title: Rational inequalities: one side is zero
description: Sal shows two ways to solve the inequality (x-1)/(x+2)>0.

title: Rational inequalities: both sides are not zero
description: Sal solves the rational inequality (x-3)/(x+4)≥2.

title: Symmetry of polynomial functions
description: Learn how to determine the symmetry of a polynomial function.

title: Partial fraction expansion
description: Partial fraction expansion is a method that allows us to re-write a relatively complex rational expression as the sum of simpler rational expressions. For example, it allows us to rewrite (3x-8)/(x²-4x-5) as 7/(6x-30)+11/(6x+6).

title: What are the complex numbers?
description: Learn about complex numbers (spoiler: they are numbers that consist of both real and imaginary parts).

title: Manipulating formulas
description: Learn how to solve problems that involve multi-variable formulas.

title: Intro to partial fraction expansion
description: Sal explains what partial fraction expansion is by rewriting (x²-2x-37)/(x²-3x-40) as the sum of 1 and two rational expressions with linear denominators.

title: Partial fraction expansion
description: Sal performs partial fraction expansion upon (10x²+12x+20)/(x³-8).

title: Partial fraction expansion
description: Represent a complicated rational fraction as a sum of simpler fractions using partial fraction expansion.

title: Partial fraction expansion: repeated factors
description: Sal performs partial fraction expansion upon (6x²-19x+15)/(x-1)(x-2)².

title: The complex plane
description: Learn how we can visualize complex numbers in a plane. This can be seen as an expansion of the 1-dimensional real number line into a 2-dimensional plane!

title: Introduction to conic sections
description: Conic sections are formed when you intersect a plane with a cone. In this tutorial, you will learn more about what makes conic sections special.

title: Basic sigma notation
description: Learn how to use and interpret sigma notation. Hint: It means take the sum!

title: Adding & subtracting complex numbers
description: Learn how to add or subtract complex numbers. For example, write (2+3i)-(1+2i) as (1+i).

title: Vector basics
description: Learn the basics of vectors, like that a vector has both magnitude and direction.

title: The features of a circle
description: Learn about the graphs of circles, and how their center and radius are represented algebraically.

title: Arithmetic series
description: Learn how to evaluate and work with finite arithmetic series.

title: Multiplying complex numbers
description: Learn how to multiply complex numbers using the fact that i^2=-1 and the distributive property. For example, multiply (1+i) by (2+3i).

title: Standard equation of a circle
description: Learn about the standard form to represent a circle with an equation. For example, the equation (x-1)^2+(y+2)^2=9 is a circle whose center is (1,-2) and radius is 3.

title: Magnitude of vectors
description: Find the magnitude of a vector given in component form.

title: Complex conjugates & dividing complex numbers
description: Learn how to divide complex numbers using the conjugate of the divisor. For example, divide (2+3i) by (-1+4i) by multiplying both the dividend and the divisor by (-1-4i).

title: Geometric sequences
description: Review geometric sequences before you dive into geometric series.

title: Scalar multiplication
description: Multiply a vector by a scalar to get a new vector.

title: Expanded equation of a circle
description: Learn how to analyze an equation of a circle that is not given in the standard form. For example, find the center of the circle whose equation is x^2+y^2+4x-5=0.

title: Vector addition & subtraction
description: Combine two vectors by adding or subtracting them to get a new vector.

title: Absolute value & angle of complex numbers
description: Learn about very important graphical features of complex numbers: their absolute value and their angle.

title: Center and radii of an ellipse
description: Learn about the basic features of ellipses: their center and the two radii that pass through it, the major radius and the minor radius.

title: Finite geometric series
description: Whether you are computing mortgage payments or calculating how many users your website will have after a few years,  geometric  series show up in life far more than you imagine.  This tutorial will review all the important concepts and more!

title: Combined vector operations
description: Use both scalar multiplication and vector addition or subtraction in the same problem!

title: Distance & midpoint of complex numbers
description: Learn how we define the distance of two complex numbers, and how we define their midpoint.

title: Unit vectors
description: Learn about special vectors called unit vectors that have a magnitude of 1.

title: Finite geometric series applications
description: Apply what you've learned about geometric series to model situations in some fun word problems.

title: Polar form of complex numbers
description: Learn how to represent complex numbers in a different way. Unlike rectangular form, which emphasizes the real and imaginary parts, polar form emphasizes the absolute value ("modulus") and the angle ("argument").

title: Advanced sigma notation
